oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics of oral phenazopyridine in goats with obstructive urolithiasis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitman, S.
Camacho, B.
Neumann, L.
Schwartz, M.
Baynes, R.
Foster, D.
Halleran, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Phenazopyridine, an azo dye and urinary bladder analgesic widely used in human medicine, is commonly used for ancil足lary pain management in the treatment of goats with obstruc足tive urolithiasis. Despite its common use in these patients, there are no published studies on the pharmacokinetic param足eters, safety, or efficacy of phenazopyridine in caprine patients. The aim of this study was to determine the pharmacokinetic pa足rameters of oral phenazopyridine administration in goats with obstructive urolithiasis following tube cystostomy surgery
